alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 06 at 6:27PM EDT until April 06 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA...SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY...NORTHERN PRINCE GEORGES...ARLINGTON AND NORTHEASTERN FAIRFAX COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF FALLS CHURCH... At 626 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over American University, or near Rosslyn, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Arlington, Rockville, Bethesda, Bowie, College Park, Greenbelt, Langley Park, Beltsville, Forestville, Falls Church, Largo, Coral Hills, Bladensburg, Pimmit Hills, Upper Marlboro, Mclean, Fedex Field, Fort Totten, Rosslyn and Crystal City. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
